review: good good good good good good

h1 turn based rogue like with mechs and a lot of abilities interface is kinda clunky and hard to navigate though music is like wagon carnival or some chill rock party depending on the mission visual side is ok and have some complex mech designs game have some redeeming qualities like advanced customization and such appears to be not that bad but either way hard to recommend h1
this is about bionic dudes ten of ten sweet
these guys make some great games
for a 10 game i think i got my moneys worth
a game that exceeds all expectations
if youre looking for a slow and methodical gridbased strategy game it does it well but i dont think itd be for everyone  also the musics quite good especially the title screen and map tracks
a perfect blend of fun and challenge

the game is actually quite enjoyable  there are moments inbetween i found the play is repetitive range whistle pistol and choke points key factors to ensure a success however there are unique traits and situations one needs to take into consideration from mission to mission and it has kept the game fun the final mission is particularly interesting  the game would be much more appealing to wider audience if not for its outdated graphics and clunky ui
funny robots go splode
love the main screen music  game is lots of fun  min 10 runs to get all achievements

this game seems to scratch a niche itch like no other year on year without fail i am drawn back to it it may not be much to look at but there surprising depth to this game once you figure it out a mechbased dungeon crawler with a roguelike arms race metagame is such a diverse mashup of concepts and yet they fit together beautifully
bvtt very good

you start the game and the music hits you with a great song after that the cheap design of ui graphics gameplay and everything else just turns you off this game you hooked me at the start and lost me 2 minutes later what a shame  maybe under all this dirt i would find a diamond in the rough after playing it for 10 hours but i am not willing to put so much time into games to maybe have fun at some point in the future with the game  definitely not recommended
i didnt like it
wonderful roguelike game
creative unique fun game
i do not recommend
underrated game
i might have been sad lonely  depressed back in 2016 but i wasnt a failure this poopass roguelite turned me into one tho
very confusing at first but very interesting once you get the hang of it
i love the level of depth and variety of ways you can approach each level for me this game was very engaging had to play it through to the end
incredibly nice strategic depth and loadout customization and exactly what indie games should be like
fain
fun

the concept of the game is interesting but the game has serious flaws the main gameloop is rather unsatisfactory and badly designed in game choices are unclear and death is imminent and unrelated to what are you doing partly it is because of the interface that lacks information or presents it without clarity the sound is especially irritating but graphics is also most of the time just rudimental it is rather a sketch of a game than a game itself dont waste your time on it
great strategy and underrated game
fun game even if it is old
trying to understand this games ui is like trying to connect the dots in a dan brown novel
i cant stomach the games visuals but technically speaking the gameplay is actually quite good
looks pretty bad to the point its hard to tell whats what also really hard
simple fun game with comedic sound bytes

pretty fun top down turn based strategy mech shooting game although i always found the mechanic where everyone fights on the tactical board in a single unit and you just switch between them to fight was kinda wierd

dont let the visual simplicity of this game fool you bionic dues is a great strategy game and i had thoroughly enjoyed my first campaign this game seems to be made with a ton of replay ability in mind so i am looking forward to playing it again in the future
maybe on 2013 was a good indie  but now i dont think so
tough but fun game for the uninitiated
fun game
fantastic turn based strategy my hours are wrong ive put far more
difficult but beatable

its hard to pick out a genre for this game its good though even if the dungeon presentation is a little samey and the plot is an excuse the variety of situations you can find yourself in and the fun ways you can get out of them give it a lot of replay value
i really tried to get into it but everything just felt so  cheap

amazing turn based strategy game that didnt get any attention this developer gets my vote of confidence if you want a strategy game that doesnt take hours to set up and play then this is an amazing choice
somehow this game went under the radar but the gameplay is solid i would pick it up on sale though
fun for a playthrough or two
man this game is hard to look at

great game i wish the visuals were a bit less eye twitching most robots look very much the same you have to look at their stats constantly which are a pain to read at least on my pc but all other aspects are awesome almost ftl material

learning curve is a straight up wall made of steel no tutorial no explanation of anything first mission each bot got oneshot by something this is before i could possibly have gear of any kind second mission each bot go oneshot by something  youre forced into a playstyle of set up traps without any way to set up said traps  youll get swarmed by dozens vs your 1 of bots with several times your hp and several times your damage per shot
great fun good graphics great sfx turnbased combat options to save game in case you mess up multiple skill levels whats not to love
i like the concept never played a game like this before so i cant really compare it to anything but i like alot of the gameplay mechanics and the esthetic of the map and the bots would recommend
the bionics are past their due date    a fun strategy rougelike with a fair bit of replayability enemies say silly stuff too
remember it being fun not played it for a long time

an excellent indie game    the theme music alone is amazing but it has a nice amount of customization can run on a potato and has enough depth that i have played it a good 34 times and im used to total war games
good

is fantastic
if the ui was a little more enjoyable then i would probably give this game a better fighting chance as it stands this game is definitely not for me
really justgood
a good indie smalltime strategy game  not a great amount of replay value but worth it when its on sale
fun  very amazing little game graphics are a bit weird looking but the game play is fun
well done and quite fun

bionic dues is a great rouge like if thats the right way to describe it maximum tactical strategy game with procedural drops and levels lots of replay value try it out  beyond all that arcen games is one of the best developers there is constant updates very responsive and so creative i own all of their library and i fully recommend all their games
mediocre tactics a bit of loot unit upgrades randomization
this is a great puzzle game well wirth a playthrough even if only on easy to experience destroying hordes of enemies

i really dont understand what game all the positive reviewers played i get how on paper this is a great game on paper its one of my favorite games but in practice the gameplay just isnt interesting the art is this horrible minimalist style that makes it tough to tell whats actually happening and while the game features suggest that thered be a lot of emergent tactics i just didnt find that it emerged when i played it
good game

a gem in the rough  its not everyones cup of tea but the feeling of always being on the edge of failure or success is exciting  it may take a few tries but once you finish you just want to go and try it again but with different choices
cant understand shit at whats going on because logs and animations are really bad and the ui is very ugly dont bother
i didnt get into this game i found it tedious and unfun i feel like there is a better game of its type out there

sothis game how do i describe this game different kind of like cyberstorm in the fact it features customizable robotic entities in turnbased gameplay its pretty great i dont have anything else like it in my library the menu system is a little confusing and the intracacies of gameplay take a while to learn but those are minor gripes not bad for a tenner even better on sale
like many arcen titles a little rough around the edges but a fun strategic experience if you can get past that
for a freebieits ok

great game with bad graphics and horrible music xd sadly im already winning my first game on normal difficulty i tend to quit roguelikes early when i win so easily but well see i really like the game though and its price is very reasonable i recommend it  but the big question is why was  i programmed to feel pain

once you get past the earlymost of the campaign this is one of the most hard tedious paininthea games i have ever playedwith enough humor wit and charm in it to keep me interested regardless i dont play it as many hours as i play other games but i do not truly stop playing it

got this game in a humble bundle several years ago and always find myself coming back to it once in a while its a unique tactical rouguelike game where you command up to four robots though theres more types than four doing missions until you get to a final mission with several bosses  lots of fun and has a killer theme song

ill be brief  into the breach won steam 2018s strategy game of the year award imo this game here has all it take to give itb several runs for its money there is a player base that would love this game just needs to find it
enjoyed it quite a bit  it can get a bit repetitive towards endgame but it is still fun and boasts a good degree of replayability  would definitley recommend to fans of the strategy genre
pick your team blow stuff up get loot try not to get blown up yourself

so damn good

i like it

the more i play it the more i like it i bounced off pretty hard on my first try and let it sit untouched in my library for a while but when i returned i got hooked much better than ive imagined recommended
easy to learn hard to master

initially i found it very confusing but with a little persistence i realised the game was really fun is that what unpolished meant haha  game cons keeping track of what improvements to buy and use was tricky though and it took a while to realise the column in the city view right was the build up of enemy strength

good turn based tactical mech game the game has minimal hand holding and gives you lots of options from your mech types to what commander to use to what missions you take on is largely your choice the commanders each have something special about them that help support a play style or give you new options to use
great turnbased mech roguelike with some deep systems
good turnbased strategy fun not dissimilar to later duskers

picked it on sale for 2 i underpaid  the best way i would describe it is as a fast moving quirky turn based strategy gameplay is simple at first but gets more complicated as you accrue gear and encounter different enemy types giving it way more depth than first blush   1010
this things trying to confuse me and i love it its kind of a shame im beggining to understand most of it

this game has really grown on me  i suffered for a bit in the beginning but after some time i came back to it and reinvested time learning how everything worked and havent regretted it since  if you take the time to learn the mechanics of this game youll find that it has wonderful depth interesting engagements and customizable replayability  id strongly recommend this to anyone that loves turnbased dungeon crawlers strategy games also the sound track is amazing

bionic dues is a game for people who really like to fiddle with stuff to get better numbers you get next to no explanation about what youre doing it looks like something that came out in the 90s and the interface is rather clumsy eg rightclicking archives an item instead of equiping it a few people will love this game most will just be confused i just found the core gameplay to be rather boring compared to dungeons of dredmor which is my benchmark for roguelikes

got this from a bundle sounded exceedingly like my thing but five minutes of the 1989 dos style graphics was enough to give this a pass i dont mind lowbudget or crude graphics especially in a roguelike but this was just confusing and unenjoyable to look at
title song is the best

i am more than a little tactical and turnbiased but this game rocks  simple to learn and crazy fun to replay  the loot situation isnt overwhelming but varied and clever enough to keep the micromanagermech tuner in me happy  seriously for the price it is at this month it is a solid must buy
arcen games are criminally woefully underated a fun strategy game would recommend at twice the price and definitely on sale
satisfying mix of puzzle and tactics candidate for both the just one more turn and just one more install award
best title theme song ever
i wish i could use all 4 mechs at one time it only lets me use one at a time is there a way to change this

havent played much yet but the abilities for the various exos sound good and the combat seems challenging and fun what really got me were the hilarious death sound effects of the bots i die avenge me not like this  lmao
turn based strategy at its best a must have vor all who like thinking about your moves simple grafics but great strategys and the archevments are fun to do
love it
gogo tanks

surprisingly good game  many similar games are worse

this is really what they call an idie gem i liked playing this game a lot and i still do when i have a little bit of time it plays like a squad based top down shooter   pros i liked the music a lot  gameplay upgrades mission types  double edged game mechanic very basically longer you play game becomes harder price  likes graphics are not too impressive but its also good for my weak laptop and its a subjective matter

fun  more fun than a lot of more expensive games    ultimately it got a little too repetitive for me  but i enjoyed myself enough with the time i played that i can happilly   recommend it  and a lot of people that like video games enjoy what i considered repetitive
